reviewText: 2 funny movies for the price of $5, definitely can't be beat!
Dumb and Dumber was hilarious and immediately a classic. Dumb and Dumberer not so much but a great price for what you get

To avoid confusion, I emphasis the second movie's title as "DumberER", just to acknowledge the imbecilic suggestion for a sequel title. Originally, I was suppose to review just "Dumb and DumberER", but somehow no video store in my area has it. I found this double feature set instead (no bonus features, just the films only), and decided rather than to chastise another comedy, I decided to compare these two films to understand the fond memories I had with the first movie and how the second film manage to be dumb for unironic reasons. "Dumber" has Jeff Daniels and then-rising comedian Jim Carrey carry the roles of two knuckleheads Harry and Lloyd. While their antics are cleverly dumb than actually dumb (something I spoke strongly against before), I can excuse that because the actors are very funny due to the great amount of spontaneity they give to their characters. "DumberER" has two relatively unknown actors playing younger versions of Harry and Lloyd. Although they succeed in looking the part of the original characters, they lack the charm and energy that Carrey and Daniels manage to deliver in their roles. The plot in "Dumber" has the lead characters going to different locations across the nation, while inadvertently fending off devious criminals with a case of stolen money. Since "DumberER" is a prequel, the leads go to high school where they met the first time and be involved in a principal's scam (Eugene Levy) to use a special ed class to extort money, a principal who keeps all his master plans in a conspicuous chest where only dumb people would find and ruin him; the premise sounded too closely like that one Scooby-Doo TV movie. "Dumber" has the mockingbird scene as one of its memorable hilarious moments. The only thing "DumberER" has as a memorable (but not hilarious) moment is Bob Saget saying 'crap' ad nauseum when Harry wipe chocolate in his house, as it lacks any genuinely funny jokes. What's worse, the prequel reused a couple of gags from the first movie, like the gasoline scene or the ending with the hot chicks asking for the duo a ride; they're less homage and more rip-off. Many songs used in "Dumber" fit the contemporary setting. "DumberER" took place in 1986, and it had two anachronistic songs: one is a Vanilla Ice track from the 1990s, and a Good Charlotte track from the 2000s. "Dumb and Dumber" is a high standard of dumb comedies, a solid cast with a fine set of directors (The Farelly Brothers) who wanted to go nuts and have fun with it. "Dumb and DumberER" is a unnecessary worthless piece of junk, shamelessly cash-grabbed by fanboys at best and desperate businessmen at worst. 4 stars for "Dumber", 2 stars for "DumberER".

The first movie is funny, but putting it with one of the worst movies of the last decade. I don't think that right. I as most people get the original by itself. The second is a B rated movie with I would say F rated actors. Simply terrible. At no price would I put this in my collection.

...to get the original, theatrical version of Dumb and Dumber that we all know (and some of us love), without having to be subjected to either:

a) The inferior "unrated" cut

b) A combo package with the terrible "Dumb and Dumberer"

Still, if you want to watch Dumb and Dumber and would greatly prefer to see the original cut, this is your only choice. It's a barebones disc, with the dreadful prequel where some interesting bonus features should be, but it's in widescreen and it's cheap. It's not the best release in the world, but it is what it is.
Great delivery time, but who cares about that, this movie is a classic and i absolutely love it!!

A classic comedy far above most other classic comedies.  Many others loose their spark as time goes by but not this one.  Most older comedies failed when I tried to share them with my 12 year old son but not Dumb and dumber.  He took to it like I did 20 years ago.

Dumb and Dumber is of course one of the funniest movies ever made, it will probably become a classic eventually. I gave this combo pack 3 stars because the other film, "Dumb and Dumberer", was not my favorite. It was a little difficult to sit through the whole thing, not sure exactly why that was. I am looking forward to the sequel that is coming out soon, "Dumb and Dumber To", which as far as I know will star the original actors.
this dvd is an old one almost a classic!!lol.its very funny dvd to watch.its also a good family movie to sit down and watch,you and your family will have a good laugh together.

This set is for a gift.  The receiver loves these movies and watches them on tv whenever he can.  I am not a fan so this way he can watch them when I am not watching tv with him and then we can both be happy.  Well worthit for the price.
